messages.content: {"thoughts":"I need to inspect the repository to understand how live data providers are stored and added. I will list files to find related hooks and services, then implement a \"+\" button in LiveDataView.tsx that triggers an add flow and persists a new provider via existing APIs (likely exposed via window.liveDataService).","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"."}}]}

{"thoughts":"Next, I will search for live data related files and the useLiveData hook to see how to add providers and persist them.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"search_files","arguments":{"query":"live data provider useLiveData providers store registry getData updateConfig triggerUpdate","path":"src"}},{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"src"}}]}

{"thoughts":"I'll open the relevant files to understand how live data providers are represented and how to add/store them from the renderer.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"read_files","arguments":{"paths":["src/renderer/hooks/useLiveData.tsx","src/renderer/services/liveDataService.ts","src/live-data/liveDataTypes.ts","src/live-data/store.js","src/live-data/registry.js","src/live-data/liveDataManager.js","src/renderer/screens/LiveDataView.tsx","src/preload.js","src/renderer/components/ui/select.tsx"]}}]}

[{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"src/renderer/hooks/useLiveData.tsx\":\"import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';\\nimport { LiveDataProvider, LiveDataProviderStatus } from '../../live-data/liveDataTypes';\\nimport { liveDataService } from '../services/liveDataService';\\n\\nexport default function useLiveData() {\\n const [services, setServices] = useState([]);\\n const [servicesById, setServicesById] = useState>({});\\n\\n const update = async () => {\\n const services = await liveDataService.getStatus()\\n updateCurrentServices(services)\\n }\\n const updateCurrentServices = (services: LiveDataProvider[]) => {\\n setServices(services)\\n \\n let newServicesById : Record = {}\\n for(const s of services){\\n newServicesById[s.id] = s\\n }\\n setServicesById(newServicesById)\\n }\\n \\n useEffect(() => {\\n update();\\n\\n const unsubscribe = liveDataService.subscribe(updateCurrentServices);\\n\\n return () => {\\n unsubscribe();\\n };\\n }, []);\\n\\n const triggerUpdate = async (serviceId: string) : Promise => {\\n return await liveDataService.triggerUpdate(serviceId)\\n }\\n const updateConfig = async (serviceId: string, updates: Partial>) : Promise => {\\n return liveDataService.updateConfig(serviceId, updates)\\n }\\n\\n return { services, servicesById, triggerUpdate, updateConfig };\\n}\",\"src/renderer/services/liveDataService.ts\":\"import { LiveDataProvider, LiveDataProviderStatus } from \\\"src/live-data/liveDataTypes\\\"\\n\\nexport type LiveDataService = {\\n subscribe: (callback: (statuses: LiveDataProviderStatus[]) => void) => () => void\\n getStatus: () => Promise\\n triggerUpdate: (serviceId: string) => Promise\\n updateConfig: (serviceId: string, updates: Partial>) => Promise\\n getData: (serviceId: string) => Promise\\n}\\n\\nexport const liveDataService: LiveDataService = { ...window.liveDataService }\",\"src/live-data/liveDataTypes.ts\":\"export type LiveDataProviderFreshnessPolicy = 'daily' | 'weekly' | 'monthly';\\nexport type LiveDataProviderAutoUpdateTrigger = 'onAppLaunch' | 'scheduled';\\n\\nexport interface LiveDataProviderAutoUpdateSettings {\\n enabled: boolean;\\n trigger: LiveDataProviderAutoUpdateTrigger;\\n time?: number; // Unix timestamp\\n}\\n\\nexport interface LiveDataProvider {\\n id: string;\\n name: string;\\n description: string;\\n lastUpdated: number; // Unix timestamp\\n freshnessPolicy: LiveDataProviderFreshnessPolicy;\\n autoUpdate: LiveDataProviderAutoUpdateSettings;\\n config: TConfig; // Service-specific configuration\\n}\\n\\nexport type LiveDataProviderStatus = LiveDataProvider & {\\n isUpdating?: boolean;\\n isFresh?: boolean;\\n};\\n\",\"src/live-data/store.js\":\"import AppStorage from '../settings/appStorage';\\n\\n// LiveDataStore persists service configs and per-service data cache.\\nexport class LiveDataStore {\\n constructor() {\\n this.storage = new AppStorage('live-data');\\n }\\n\\n getServices() {\\n try {\\n const raw = this.storage.getItem('services-config');\\n return raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : null;\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.error('[live-data] Failed to read services-config:', e);\\n return null;\\n }\\n }\\n\\n setServices(services) {\\n try {\\n this.storage.setItem('services-config', JSON.stringify(services));\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.error('[live-data] Failed to write services-config:', e);\\n }\\n }\\n\\n getServiceData(serviceId) {\\n try {\\n const raw = this.storage.getItem(`data:${serviceId}`);\\n return raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : null;\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.error('[live-data] Failed to read service data for', serviceId, e);\\n return null;\\n }\\n }\\n\\n setServiceData(serviceId, data) {\\n try {\\n this.storage.setItem(`data:${serviceId}`, JSON.stringify(data));\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.error('[live-data] Failed to write service data for', serviceId, e);\\n }\\n }\\n}\\n\",\"src/live-data/registry.js\":\"/*\\nLive Data Provider Registry\\n- Allows registering providers and looking them up by service id.\\n*/\\n\\nexport class LiveDataRegistry {\\n constructor() {\\n this.providers = new Map();\\n }\\n\\n register(provider) {\\n if (!provider || !provider.id) throw new Error('Provider must have an id');\\n this.providers.set(provider.id, provider);\\n }\\n\\n get(serviceId) {\\n return this.providers.get(serviceId);\\n }\\n}\\n\",\"src/live-data/liveDataManager.js\":\"import { ipcMain } from 'electron';\\nimport IPC_HANDLER_KEYS from '../ipcHandlersKeys';\\nimport { LiveDataStore } from './store';\\nimport { LiveDataRegistry } from './registry';\\nimport { createAgentPricesProvider } from './providers/agentPricesProvider';\\nimport { createFetchJsonProvider } from './providers/fetchJsonProvider';\\nimport { LiveDataProviderStatus } from './liveDataTypes'\\n\\nconst DEFAULT_SERVICES = [\\n {\\n id: 'agent-prices',\\n name: 'Agent Prices',\\n description: 'Fetches the latest prices for common AI models from various providers.',\\n freshnessPolicy: 'daily',\\n autoUpdate: { enabled: true, trigger: 'onAppLaunch' },\\n lastUpdated: 0,\\n config: { url: 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BerriAI/litellm/main/model_prices_and_context_window.json' },\\n isUpdating: false,\\n },\\n // Example slot for a dynamic JSON fetch service (user can add more via UI in future)\\n // { id: 'my-json-service', name: 'My JSON', description: 'Fetches custom JSON', freshnessPolicy: 'weekly', autoUpdate: { enabled: false }, config: { url: 'https://example.com/data.json' } }\\n];\\n\\nexport class LiveDataManager {\\n constructor(projectRoot, window) {\\n this.projectRoot = projectRoot;\\n this.window = window;\\n\\n this.store = new LiveDataStore();\\n this.registry = new LiveDataRegistry();\\n this._ipcBound = false;\\n\\n this.services = this._loadServices();\\n\\n // Register built-in providers\\n this.registry.register(createAgentPricesProvider(this.store));\\n // Generic provider enables future-proof dynamic services by URL\\n this.registry.register(createFetchJsonProvider(this.store));\\n }\\n\\n _loadServices() {\\n const stored = this.store.getServices();\\n if (stored && Array.isArray(stored)) {\\n const normalized = stored.map(s => normalizeService(s));\\n // Ensure defaults exist\\n const ids = new Set(normalized.map(s => s.id));\\n for (const def of DEFAULT_SERVICES) {\\n if (!ids.has(def.id)) normalized.push(normalizeService(def));\\n }\\n return normalized;\\n }\\n return DEFAULT_SERVICES.map(s => normalizeService(s));\\n }\\n\\n _saveServices() {\\n this.store.setServices(this.services);\\n }\\n\\n async init() {\\n this._registerIpcHandlers();\\n this._maybeTriggerOnLaunchUpdates();\\n }\\n\\n _registerIpcHandlers() {\\n if (this._ipcBound) return;\\n\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_GET_STATUS, () => this.getServicesStatus());\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_TRIGGER_UPDATE, (_event, { serviceId }) => this.triggerUpdate(serviceId));\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_UPDATE_CONFIG, (_event, { serviceId, updates }) => this.updateServiceConfig(serviceId, updates));\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_GET_DATA, (_event, { serviceId }) => this.getServiceData(serviceId));\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_ADD_SERVICE, (_event, service) => this.addService(service));\\n ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_REMOVE_SERVICE, (_event, { serviceId }) => this.removeService(serviceId));\\n\\n this._ipcBound = true;\\n }\\n\\n getServicesStatus() {\\n return this.services.map(svc => ({ ...svc, isFresh: computeIsFresh(svc) }));\\n }\\n\\n updateServiceConfig(serviceId, updates) {\\n const idx = this.services.findIndex(s => s.id === serviceId);\\n if (idx === -1) return null;\\n const merged = normalizeService({ ...this.services[idx], ...updates });\\n this.services[idx] = merged;\\n this._saveServices();\\n this._emitStatus();\\n return merged;\\n }\\n\\n addService(service) {\\n // Allows users to add new services by specifying id, name, url, and update settings.\\n if (!service?.id) throw new Error('Service id is required');\\n const exists = this.services.some(s => s.id === service.id);\\n if (exists) throw new Error('Service with this id already exists');\\n\\n // If service.type is 'fetch-json' we keep its id unique and will use generic provider.\\n // If service.id matches a provider id (like 'agent-prices'), it will use that provider.\\n\\n this.services.push(normalizeService(service));\\n this._saveServices();\\n this._emitStatus();\\n return normalized;\\n }\\n\\n removeService(serviceId) {\\n const idx = this.services.findIndex(s => s.id === serviceId);\\n if (idx === -1) return false;\\n this.services.splice(idx, 1);\\n this._saveServices();\\n this._emitStatus();\\n return true;\\n }\\n\\n async triggerUpdate(serviceId) {\\n const svc = this.services.find(s => s.id === serviceId);\\n if (!svc || svc.isUpdating) return this.getServicesStatus();\\n\\n svc.isUpdating = true;\\n this._emitStatus();\\n\\n try {\\n // Select provider by most specific: service.id, or fall back to generic fetch-json\\n let provider = this.registry.get(svc.id);\\n if (!provider && svc.config?.url) {\\n provider = this.registry.get('fetch-json');\\n }\\n\\n if (provider && typeof provider.update === 'function') {\\n await provider.update(svc);\\n } else {\\n // No provider registered; do nothing but simulate delay\\n await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 500));\\n }\\n\\n svc.lastUpdated = Date.now();\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.error(`[live-data] update failed for ${serviceId}:`, e?.message || e);\\n } finally {\\n svc.isUpdating = false;\\n this._saveServices();\\n this._emitStatus();\\n }\\n\\n return this.getServicesStatus();\\n }\\n\\n async getServiceData(serviceId) {\\n const svc = this.services.find(s => s.id === serviceId);\\n if (!svc) return null;\\n\\n try {\\n let provider = this.registry.get(svc.id);\\n if (!provider && svc.config?.url) provider = this.registry.get('fetch-json');\\n if (provider && typeof provider.getData === 'function') {\\n return await provider.getData(svc);\\n }\\n return this.store.getServiceData(serviceId);\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.warn('[live-data] getServiceData error for', serviceId, e?.message || e);\\n return this.store.getServiceData(serviceId) || null;\\n }\\n }\\n\\n _emitStatus() {\\n if (!this.window || this.window.isDestroyed()) return;\\n try {\\n this.window.webContents.send(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.LIVE_DATA_SUBSCRIBE, this.getServicesStatus());\\n } catch (e) {\\n console.warn('Failed to emit LIVE_DATA_SUBSCRIBE:', e);\\n }\\n }\\n\\n _maybeTriggerOnLaunchUpdates() {\\n for (const svc of this.services) {\\n if (svc.autoUpdate?.enabled && (svc.autoUpdate?.trigger === 'onAppLaunch')) {\\n if (!computeIsFresh(svc)) {\\n this.triggerUpdate(svc.id); // fire-and-forget\\n }\\n }\\n }\\n }\\n\\n stopWatching() {\\n // Placeholder for future scheduled triggers\\n }\\n}\\n\\n// Normalize shape for service entries read from storage or defaults\\nexport function normalizeService(service) {\\n return {\\n id: service.id,\\n name: service.name,\\n description: service.description,\\n freshnessPolicy: service.freshnessPolicy || service.freshnessPolicy || 'daily',\\n autoUpdate: typeof service.autoUpdate === 'object'\\n ? { enabled: !!service.autoUpdate.enabled, trigger: service.autoUpdate.trigger || 'onAppLaunch', time: service.autoUpdate.time }\\n : { enabled: !!service.autoUpdate, trigger: 'onAppLaunch' },\\n lastUpdated: typeof service.lastUpdated === 'number'\\n ? service.lastUpdated\\n : (service.lastUpdated ? new Date(service.lastUpdated).getTime() : 0),\\n config: service.config || {}, // free-form; may include url, headers, params, etc.\\n isUpdating: !!service.isUpdating,\\n };\\n}\\n\\n// Interface (documentation) for providers\\n// A provider implementation must expose: { id, update(service, deps), getData(service, deps) }\\n// - id: string (matches service id for built-ins or a generic provider id for dynamic services)\\n// - update: performs network or internal refresh, should persist data via store if applicable\\n// - getData: returns current data snapshot for the service\\n\\nexport function computeIsFresh(service, now = Date.now()) {\\n if (!service.lastUpdated) return false;\\n const diffMs = now - service.lastUpdated;\\n const dayMs = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;\\n switch (service.freshnessPolicy) {\\n case 'daily':\\n return diffMs < dayMs;\\n case 'weekly':\\n return diffMs < 7 * dayMs;\\n case 'monthly':\\n return diffMs < 30 * dayMs; // Approximate month\\n default:\\n return false;\\n }\\n}\\n\\n\",\"src/renderer/screens/LiveDataView.tsx\":\"import { useState } from 'react';\\nimport type { LiveDataProvider, LiveDataProviderStatus } from '../../live-data/liveDataTypes';\\nimport { Select, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectTrigger, SelectValue } from '../components/ui/Select';\\nimport { Switch } from '../components/ui/Switch';\\nimport useLiveData from '../hooks/useLiveData';\\n\\nfunction formatLastUpdated(ts: number | undefined | null) {\\n if (!ts) return 'never';\\n try {\\n return new Date(ts).toLocaleString();\\n } catch {\\n return 'never';\\n }\\n}\\n\\nfunction JsonBlock({ data }: { data: any }) {\\n return (\\n 
\\n      {data == null ? 'No data available.' : JSON.stringify(data, null, 2)}\\n
\\n );\\n}\\n\\nexport default function LiveDataView() {\\n const { services, servicesById, triggerUpdate, updateConfig } = useLiveData()\\n const [openViewer, setOpenViewer] = useState>({});\\n const [loadingData, setLoadingData] = useState>({});\\n const [serviceData, setServiceData] = useState>({});\\n const [errorByService, setErrorByService] = useState>({});\\n\\n const toggleViewer = async (s: LiveDataProviderStatus) => {\\n const isOpen = !!openViewer[s.id];\\n const next = { ...openViewer, [s.id]: !isOpen };\\n setOpenViewer(next);\\n\\n // If opening and no data loaded yet, try to fetch it now.\\n if (!isOpen && serviceData[s.id] === undefined) {\\n await fetchLatestForService(s);\\n }\\n };\\n\\n const fetchLatestForService = async (s: LiveDataProviderStatus) => {\\n setLoadingData(prev => ({ ...prev, [s.id]: true }));\\n setErrorByService(prev => ({ ...prev, [s.id]: undefined }));\\n\\n try {\\n let data: any = null;\\n if ((window as any).liveDataService?.getData) {\\n data = await (window as any).liveDataService.getData(s.id);\\n }\\n setServiceData(prev => ({ ...prev, [s.id]: data }));\\n } catch (e: any) {\\n setErrorByService(prev => ({ ...prev, [s.id]: e?.message || 'Failed to load latest data' }));\\n } finally {\\n setLoadingData(prev => ({ ...prev, [s.id]: false }));\\n }\\n };\\n\\n const handleUpdateNow = async (s: LiveDataProviderStatus) => {\\n try {\\n await triggerUpdate(s.id);\\n } finally {\\n // If the JSON viewer is open for this service, refresh its data preview to reflect latest updates\\n if (openViewer[s.id]) {\\n await fetchLatestForService(s);\\n }\\n }\\n };\\n\\n return (\\n

=> {\\n const listener = (_event, files) => callback(files);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n },\\n listFiles: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_LIST, { projectId }),\\n readFile: (projectId, relPath, encoding = 'utf8') => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ, { projectId, relPath, encoding }),\\n readFileBinary: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ_BINARY, { projectId, relPath }),\\n readDirectory: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ_DIRECTORY, { projectId, relPath }),\\n writeFile: (projectId, relPath, content, encoding = 'utf8') => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_WRITE, { projectId, relPath, content, encoding }),\\n deleteFile: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_DELETE, { projectId, relPath }),\\n renameFile: (projectId, relPathSource, relPathTarget) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_RENAME, { projectId, relPathSource, relPathTarget }),\\n uploadFile: (projectId, name, content) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_UPLOAD, { projectId, name, content })\\n};\\n\\nconst TASKS_API = {\\n subscribe: (callback) => {\\n const listener = (_event, tasks) => callback(tasks);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n },\\n listTasks: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_LIST, { projectId }),\\n getTask: (projectId, taskId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_GET, { projectId, taskId }),\\n createTask: (projectId, task) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_CREATE, { projectId, task }),\\n updateTask: (projectId, taskId, data) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_UPDATE, { projectId, taskId, data }),\\n deleteTask: (projectId, taskId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_DELETE, { projectId, taskId }),\\n getFeature: (projectId, featureId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_GET, { projectId, featureId }),\\n addFeature: (projectId, taskId, feature) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_ADD, { projectId, taskId, feature }),\\n updateFeature: (projectId, taskId, featureId, data) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_UPDATE, { projectId, taskId, featureId, data }),\\n deleteFeature: (projectId, taskId, featureId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_DELETE, { projectId, taskId, featureId }),\\n reorderFeatures: (projectId, taskId, payload) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURES_REORDER, { projectId, taskId, payload })\\n};\\n\\nconst CHATS_API = {\\n listModels: (config) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_LIST_MODELS, { config }),\\n subscribe: (callback) => {\\n const listener = (_event, chats) => callback(chats);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n },\\n listChats: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_LIST, { projectId }),\\n createChat: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_CREATE, { projectId }),\\n getChat: (projectId, chatId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_GET, { projectId, chatId }),\\n deleteChat: (projectId, chatId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_DELETE, { projectId, chatId }),\\n getCompletion: (projectId, chatId, newMessages, config) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_COMPLETION, { projectId, chatId, newMessages, config }),\\n};\\n\\nconst NOTIFICATIONS_API = {\\n onOpenNotification: (callback) => {\\n const listener = (_event, metadata) => callback(metadata);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_ON_OPEN, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_ON_OPEN, listener);\\n },\\n\\n sendOs: (data) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_SEND_OS, data),\\n subscribe: (callback) => {\\n const listener = (_event, payload) => callback(payload);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n },\\n getRecentNotifications: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_RECENT, { projectId }),\\n getUnreadNotificationsCount: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_UNREADCOUNT, { projectId }),\\n markAllNotificationsAsRead: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_MARKALLASREAD, { projectId }),\\n markNotificationAsRead: (projectId, id) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_MARKASREAD, { projectId, id }),\\n deleteAllNotifications: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_DELETEALL, { projectId }),\\n create: (projectId, input) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.NOTIFICATIONS_CREATE, { projectId, input }),\\n};\\n\\nconst PROJECTS_API = {\\n subscribe: (callback) => {\\n const listener = (_event, projects) => callback(projects);\\n ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n },\\n listProjects: () => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_LIST),\\n getProject: (id) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_GET, { id }),\\n createProject: (project) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_CREATE, { id: project?.id, project }),\\n updateProject: (id, project) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_UPDATE, { id, project }),\\n deleteProject: (id) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_DELETE, { id }),\\n reorderTask: (projectId, fromIndex, toIndex) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.PROJECTS_TASK_REORDER, { projectId, fromIndex, toIndex }),\\n};\\n\\nconst SCREENSHOT_API = {\\n capture: (options) => ipcRenderer.invoke('screenshot:capture', options),\\n};\\n\\nconst SETTINGS_API = {\\n subscribe: {\\n return ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FACTORY_LIST_ACTIVE);\\n },\\n listRunHistory: () => {\\n return ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FACTORY_HISTORY_LIST);\\n },\\n getRunMessages: (runId) => {\\n return ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FACTORY_HISTORY_MESSAGES, { runId });\\n },\\n deleteRun: (runId) => {\\n return ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FACTORY_HISTORY_DELETE, { runId });\\n },\\n // Pricing\\n getPricing: () => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FACTORY_PRICING_GET),\\n refreshPricing: (provider, url) => IPC_HANDLER_KEYS;\\n\"}"},{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"src/live-data/providers/fetchJsonProvider.js\":\"/*\\nGeneric Fetch JSON provider\\n- Supports dynamic services configured with a URL (service.config.url)\\n- Fetches JSON and stores it. Useful for future-proof expansion without wiring code.\\n*/\\n\\nimport https from 'https';\\nimport http from 'http';\\n\\nfunction fetchJson(url) {\\n  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {\\n    try {\\n      const lib = url.startsWith('https') ? https : http;\\n      const req = lib.get(url, (res) => {\\n        if (res.statusCode < 200 || res.statusCode >= 300) {\\n          reject(new Error(`HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));\\n          res.resume();\\n          return;\\n        }\\n        let data = '';\\n        res.setEncoding('utf8');\\n        res.on('data', chunk => { data += chunk; });\\n        res.on('end', () => {\\n          try {\\n            const parsed = JSON.parse(data);\\n            resolve(parsed);\\n          } catch (e) {\\n            reject(e);\\n          }\\n        });\\n      });\\n      req.on('error', reject);\\n    } catch (e) {\\n      reject(e);\\n    }\\n  });\\n}\\n\\nexport function createFetchJsonProvider(store) {\\n  return {\\n    id: 'fetch-json',\\n    update: async (service) => {\\n      const url = service?.config?.url;\\n      if (!url) throw new Error('Missing service.config.url');\\n      const data = await fetchJson(url);\\n      store.setServiceData(service.id, { updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(), data });\\n      return true;\\n    },\\n    getData: async (service) => {\\n      return store.getServiceData(service.id) || null;\\n    }\\n  };\\n}\\n\",\"src/live-data/providers/agentPricesProvider.js\":\"import { getPricingManager } from '../../tools/factory/mainOrchestrator';\\n\\n// Agent Prices provider bridges to factory-ts pricing manager.\\n// It does not persist its own data; instead, it refreshes pricing manager\\n// and mirrors a snapshot into LiveDataStore for renderer consumption.\\nexport function createAgentPricesProvider(store) {\\n  return {\\n    id: 'agent-prices',\\n    update: async (service) => {\\n      const pricing = getPricingManager();\\n      if (!pricing) throw new Error('Pricing manager not initialized');\\n      // Allow URL override via service.config.url, otherwise fallback to litellm list\\n      const url = service?.config?.url || 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BerriAI/litellm/main/model_prices_and_context_window.json';\\n      await pricing.refresh(undefined, url);\\n\\n      // Pull snapshot for caching in store\\n      const snapshot = typeof pricing.listPrices === 'function'\\n        ? pricing.listPrices()\\n        : { updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(), prices: [] };\\n      store.setServiceData(service.id, snapshot);\\n      return true;\\n    },\\n    getData: async (service) => {\\n      // First prefer pricing manager real-time, fallback to cached store\\n      try {\\n        const pricing = getPricingManager();\\n        if (pricing && typeof pricing.listPrices === 'function') {\\n          const snapshot = pricing.listPrices();\\n          if (snapshot) return snapshot;\\n        }\\n      } catch (_) {}\\n      return store.getServiceData(service.id) || { updatedAt: new Date().toISOString(), prices: [] };\\n    }\\n  };\\n}\\n\"}"}]
